title: Domain 1.3: Given a scnenario, use features and tools of Microsoft Windows 10 operating system.
content:
üß† Task Manager

Use Ctrl + Shift + Esc to open Task Manager. It's used for performance monitoring and troubleshooting.

  • Services: Manage background services. Link to services.msc.
  • Startup: Enable/disable apps at startup. Useful for speeding up boot times.
  • Performance: Real-time graphs for CPU, memory, disk, network, GPU.
  • Processes: See and end running tasks and apps.
  • Users: View active users and their resource usage.

üß∞ Microsoft Management Console (MMC) Snap-ins

Access these via Run (Win + R) using their respective .msc commands:

  • Event Viewer (eventvwr.msc): View system/application logs (errors, warnings, etc.).
  • Disk Management (diskmgmt.msc): Manage partitions, volumes, formatting, drive letters.
  • Task Scheduler (taskschd.msc): Automate recurring system tasks.
  • Device Manager (devmgmt.msc): Manage and troubleshoot hardware and drivers.
  • Certificate Manager (certmgr.msc): View/manage digital certificates.
  • Local Users and Groups (lusrmgr.msc): Manage user accounts and groups (Pro and above).
  • Performance Monitor (perfmon.msc): Advanced live system monitoring.
  • Group Policy Editor (gpedit.msc): Configure policies for users and systems (Pro/Enterprise only).

üõ†Ô∏è Additional Tools

  • System Information (msinfo32.exe): View full system specs and configuration.
  • Resource Monitor (resmon.exe): Deep dive into performance stats by process.
  • System Configuration (msconfig.exe): Control boot settings, services, and troubleshooting modes.
  • Disk Cleanup (cleanmgr.exe): Delete temp files, logs, and other space-hogging files.
  • Disk Defragmenter (dfrgui.exe): Reorganize data on HDDs for faster access.
  • Registry Editor (regedit.exe): Directly edit Windows Registry. Advanced users only!
